title: Display of searches in address bar at top rather than search box in middle of screen.
content: In recent months when I start typing a search in the Google search engine box in the middle of the page, the typing immediately jumps to the Google/Firefox web address search bar at the top of the page -- that has usually been reserved for typing in a specific web address, not a general search. It is harder to read while typing, and there is no point in having a large search box in the middle of the screen if all search activity is immediately redirected to the small address bar space at the top of the screen. I would like to restore my searches to the Google search box in the middle of the screen.
creator: sfroot

title: Firefox for Mac/OS 10.11.6 (Mac/OS X El Capitan
content:
For unfortunate reasons too tedious and mundane to discuss here, I am stuck with Mac/OS 10.11.6. I am looking for a version of Firefox that will run under that version of Mac/OS. I did the basic research and was directed Firefox version 78. After that, I was directed to the Extended Support Release. When I downloaded and ran that, I was directed to the Apple App Store where no version of Firefox could be found. Where to next?

Can someone offer me a link to a version of Firefox that I can download and run on Mac/OS 10.11.6? Please.
creator: kim_grossman

title: Firefox page is "grayed out" for anything and everything I try to visit. Nothing changes except a blank screen.
content: Whenever I open firefox I am left with a grayed out screen with no other information given. Any time I click bookmark within that tab, nothing happens. If I open a new tab with a link, I get the name of the website on the tab and a grayed out screen. Everything else on my computer works fine with the internet (including microsoft edge that I am using now). I only started experiencing this issue after installing avast cleanup and premium security, but I can't find anything that is "blocking" firefox or its access to the internet. I don't know what else to do, I've had a similar issue occur before where I've been using Avast's cleaning service and selected Firefox's browser cache or downloads or something, and I don't recall how I fixed it. I can only assume it has something to do the antivirus that I installed, but I don't know what to do to fix firefox, lest I just uninstall the antivirus. Please Help?
creator: sppeedddemonn

title: Removing Total Adblock.
content:
On the Total Adblock site it gives these directions for removing the program: "Mozilla Firefox Uninstalling Adblock from your Mozilla Firefox browser is very simple and can be done within a few clicks. Go to the Extensions Page on Mozilla Firefox copy this link into the address bar of your browser:about:addons 

Find Total Adblock within your plugins . Click the 3 Dots. Click Remove."

I do not know where the "extensions page" is. Nor where to find it. While I have been using personal computers for decades, I am still a complete beginner when it comes to any technical jargon. If someone would kindly give me directions in English about getting rid of this annoying extension/program? I would deeply appreciate it.
creator: MozSupIsCrap

title: Firefox Browser Won't Load Background Images
content:
Starting earlier this week my Firefox suddenly stopped being able to load background images. Every website I visit looks very strange and often is unusable. I'm running Mac 10.14.6. Tried several things including uninstall and reinstalling Firefox and no difference.

Attached are screenshots of espn.com in Safari where you can see the gray bar at the top and box around the dropdown window background. This is happening on EVERY website. Help!
creator: afimovieproducer
